sentences.english: We are relieved to hear the news.
sentences.chinese: 我們聽到消息後感到欣慰。

sentences.english: Australia's development and progress, I am sincerely pleased.
sentences.chinese: 對澳大利亞的發展和進步，我感到由衷欣慰。

sentences.english: Watch sister fierceness, michele belot are very moved and very gratified.
sentences.chinese: 看着姐妹情深，碧羅很感動也很欣慰。

sentences.english: A falling New Zealand dollar may not placate producers.
sentences.chinese: 新西蘭元的下跌也不會令奶農感到欣慰。

sentences.english: Welcome the support of super-the contrary, I am very happy.
sentences.chinese: 欣超的對比支持，我很欣慰。

sentences.english: All the ugly girls have got married. I'm gratified.
sentences.chinese: 醜女們都嫁出去了，我很欣慰。

sentences.english: What a talented artist, I feel so gratified.
sentences.chinese: 天才的藝術家，朕很欣慰。

sentences.english: Thankfully, there is no reason to believe that is so. But Field-Marshal Tantawi and his generals need to allay these suspicions.
sentences.chinese: 令人欣慰的是我們還找不到任何理由來相信這一說法。

sentences.english: Best of all, I realized that Tippy left behind all of my good memories of him.
sentences.chinese: 最欣慰的是，我理解到蒂皮給我留下了所有美好回憶。

sentences.english: The swallows and sparrows are very pleased to find a place on the roof of the hall for their nests.
sentences.chinese: 燕雀爲擁有屋頂下面的一個位置而欣慰不已。

sentences.english: Thankfully, such a deal would not affect users of the website.
sentences.chinese: 令人欣慰的是，這筆交易並不會影響到網站用戶。

sentences.english: I was not go to the dance, neither did Yin Ling.
sentences.chinese: 令我們欣慰的是，謠言沒有流傳開來。

sentences.english: Beichen has finally decided to return to playing pool, Tess felt relieved.
sentences.chinese: 池北辰終於決定重回球場打球，泰斯感到欣慰。

sentences.english: We are glad to inform you that the past year has been a most succe ful one.
sentences.chinese: 我們欣慰的告知您，去年度業務是最成功的一年。

sentences.english: I'm 130 pounds at 26, and I'm happy with that.
sentences.chinese: 我現在是26歲130英磅，對此我非常欣慰。

sentences.english: The son see flowers famous feel very gratified.
sentences.chinese: 花拉看到兒子成名感到十分欣慰。

definition: to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
